bookTitle: St. Francis of Assisi: Passion, Poverty and the Man who Transformed the Catholic Church

questions.question: How many friars were in the community when they decided to get an endorsement from the pope?
distractors: Seven
Twenty-four
Forty
Seventy-two
One hundred

questions.question: Why did the friars travel to Rome?
questions.correctAnswer: To get approval for their way of life from the pope
distractors: To seek financial support for their missions
To ask permission to preach throughout Italy
To receive training in theology
To establish a monastery in Rome
To participate in a church council

questions.question: What did Francis bring to share with the pope?
questions.correctAnswer: He had a brief Rule of life that was mostly composed of scripture verses
distractors: A detailed plan for establishing monasteries
Letters of recommendation from bishops
Gifts from the people of Assisi
A theological treatise on poverty
Relics from San Damiano

questions.question: Who helped Francis and the brothers to get a meeting with the pope? How was he able to do this?
questions.correctAnswer: The Bishop of Assisi, Guido - Bishop Guido was in Rome on business and obtained a recommendation from a cardinal
distractors: Cardinal Hugolino - he was a personal friend of Francis
Brother Bernard - he had connections in Rome
A wealthy patron - he paid for an audience
Brother Sylvester - he was a priest with church connections
The Benedictine abbot - he knew the papal court

questions.question: What happened after the initial meeting with the pope that made him change his mind and call the brothers back?
questions.correctAnswer: The pope had a dream that a poor beggar appeared with his arms outstretched and held up a basilica preventing it from falling
distractors: A cardinal convinced him of Francis' holiness
Francis performed a miracle in the papal court
The pope received a vision while at prayer
News came of the friars' good works
The bishop returned with more information

questions.question: What did Francis say was his and the brothers' vocation during his conversation with the pope?
questions.correctAnswer: To remain humble and to follow in the footsteps of Christ's humility
distractors: To preach the gospel to all nations
To serve the poor and the lepers
To rebuild the churches of Italy
To live in perfect poverty
To pray for the conversion of sinners

questions.question: What did Pope Innocent say to the doubtful cardinal about Francis and the brothers?
questions.correctAnswer: I know Francis will do great things for the Church. Through his Order, he will renew the Church
distractors: Their way of life is too extreme and will fail
We must watch them carefully to ensure orthodoxy
They will need our guidance to succeed
Their poverty is admirable but impractical
Time will tell if their vision is from God

questions.question: Where did the friars take up residence once they returned to Assisi? What was their rent?
questions.correctAnswer: They moved to their humble residence of St Mary of the Angels. Their rent was a basket of fish
distractors: They returned to Rivotorto. Their rent was prayers for the owner
They moved to San Damiano. They paid no rent
They settled at San Pietro. Their rent was manual labor
They lived at the bishop's palace. They paid rent in services
They stayed in the town square. There was no rent
